Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: 1. Understand the Goal: The user wants a Python dictionary representing a DECLARE model for a specific business scenario (Product Design and Launch Process). The dictionary must adhere to a specific structure and key definitions provided in the prompt.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 2. Analyze the Input Data (Scenario): Activities (Nodes): 1. IG (Idea Generation) 2. DD (Design Draft) ... Process Flow (Inferred): IG -> DD (Brainstorm -> Design) DD -> TFC (Design -> Check) DD -> CE (Design -> Cost) ... Simplified Flow: IG -> DD -> (TFC, CE) -> PC -> LT -> UT -> AG -> MP -> FL.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 3. Analyze the Model Structure (Prompt Requirements): The dictionary has 14 keys. Group 1 (Unitary/Existential): existence, absence, exactly_one, init ... Group 2 (Relational): responded_existence, coexistence, ... Format: {activity_1, activity_2: {support: 1.0, confidence: 1.0}} ... Interpretation: {succession: { (A, B): {support: 1.0, confidence: 1.0} }}.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: 4. Constructing the Dictionary: Base Activities: IG, DD, TFC, CE, PC, LT, UT, AG, MP, FL. existence: Every activity happens at least once ... init: The process starts with IG. responded_existence: IG -> DD DD -> TFC ... succession: A must be immediately followed by B. Matches the flow ... altresponse, altprecedence, altsuccession: TFC and CE ... chainresponse, chainprecedence, chainsuccession: IG -> DD -> TFC ...

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: 5. Refining the Model for the User: The prompt asks to construct the dictionary ... core flow: 1. IG -> DD -> (TFC, CE) -> PC -> LT -> UT -> AG -> MP -> FL existence: All activities ... absence: None ... exactly_one: FL ... Relationships: Succession (Immediate): IG-DD, DD-TFC, DD-CE, TFC-PC, CE-PC ...

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: 6. Drafting the Dictionary Content: declare_model = { existence: { IG: {support: 1.0, confidence: 1.0}, DD: ... }, absence: {}, exactly_one: {FL: ...}, init: {IG: ...}, precedence: { (IG, DD): ..., (IG, AG): ... }, succession: { (IG, DD): ..., (DD, TFC): ..., ... }, altsuccession: { (TFC, PC): ..., (CE, PC): ... }, ... }

Name: Validation - PE
Text: 7. Refining based on Prompt Specifics: The prompt defines the structure: For the keys {existence, ...}, ... Key: existence Value: { IG: {support: 1.0, confidence: 1.0}, ... } Key: succession Value: { (IG, DD): {support: 1.0, confidence: 1.0}, ... } This matches standard pm4py conventions.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 8. Final Polish of the Dictionary: existence: All 10. absence: None. exactly_one: FL. init: IG. succession: IG -> DD DD -> TFC DD -> CE TFC -> PC CE -> PC PC -> LT LT -> UT UT -> AG AG -> MP MP -> FL. response: Same set ... precedence: IG before all others. coexistence: Leave empty ... alt...: TFC and CE both leading to PC. chain...: IG, DD, TFC or IG, DD, CE. non...: Leave empty.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: 10. Final Review of Scenario Logic: Does the process make sense? Idea -> Design -> (Feasibility/Cost) -> Prototype -> Test -> User -> Approved -> Marketing -> Launch. Yes.
